data.title: Anagrammatic
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    p, q = input().upper().split()
    print("true") if sorted(list(p)) == sorted(list(q)) else print("false")
data.statement: Identify if sets of words are anagrams of one another.  Anagrams are words spelled with the same quantity and choice of letters, like "oafs" and "sofa."

testCases.title: Longer pairs
testCases.testIn:
7
antler lea-rnt
antler renata
listen silent
enlist tinsel
space-cadet escaped-cat
taco-grey Category
the-eyes THEY-SEE
testCases.testOut:
false
false
true
true
true
false
true

testCases.title: Longer pairs
testCases.testIn:

deigns design

Holy_Cow coy_howl

true
true
true
true

true

testCases.title: CaSe sEnSiTiViTy
testCases.testIn:
3
Cat Act
dog GOD
abracadabra ABRACADABRA

testCases.title: CaSe sEnSiTiViTy
testCases.testIn:
4
Cart tRac
Merited Demerit
TraSHed hARDEst
CASEINSENSITIVE casseinsensitive

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of pairs of strings to test.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A pair of space separated strings [[P]] [[Q]] to be tested.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> The string "true" if the strings were anagrams of each other; or "false" if they were not.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Identify if sets of words are anagrams of one another. Anagrams are words spelled with the same quantity and choice of letters, like "oafs" and "sofa."
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of pairs of strings to test.
Next N lines: A pair of space separated strings P Q to be tested.
Output
N lines: The string "true" if the strings were anagrams of each other; or "false" if they were not.
Constraints
N ≤ 32
length of P, Q ≤ 64
Example
Input
2
dog god
mouse assume
Output
true
false
